statement.p: Identify the rate of change and initial value for the linear situation modeled below.

ul.li: Rate of Change: \displaystyle{6} Rate of change is a unit rate (how many y's for every 1 x). So it is calculated as \displaystyle\frac{{\Delta{y}}}{{\Delta{x}}} . In this case \displaystyle\Delta{y}={12} and \displaystyle\Delta{x}={2} , so \displaystyle\frac{{\Delta{y}}}{{\Delta{x}}}=\frac{{12}}{{2}}={6}

Initial Value: \displaystyle{8} Initial value is the starting amount. Mathematically the start is represented by when \displaystyle{x} is \displaystyle{0} . So we find \displaystyle{0} under the \displaystyle{x} column and look at the y-value next to it.
